body.p:
Catlettsburg Ky
May 19th 1865
To His Excellency
Thos. E. Bramlett Eq
Governor of Kentucky
Frankfort Ky
Dear Sir

My old friend Frank Loar has been fined seventy dollars for selling Liquor to soldiers, in this county at the last term of our circuit court The whisky was sold by his family and he was not at Home & did not know of it They are very ignorant and did not want to take the money but one of the soldiers spoke up & said to the woman you had better take the mony & she did so not with any intention of violating the
law. Loar is a very Poor man with a large family and the only way that he has of supporting ^them^ is by daly labor I would by glad if you would release the portion of the fine that goes to the Jury fund and I know you would have this payer of Loar's family

Your obedient
servant
J. D. Jones

Boyd Cir Ct
vs
Frank Loar
$70.
Tipling
21 June/65
